meanings.definition: A waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait.
meanings.sent1: The duck swam gracefully in the pond.
meanings.sent2: I saw a duck at the park today.
meanings.sent3: Why did the duck bring a ruler to the pond? To measure the depth!
meanings.sent4: She moved through the crowd like a duck through water.
meanings.sent5: The duck's quack echoed across the lake.

meanings.definition: To lower the head or body quickly to avoid a blow or missile.
meanings.sent1: He had to duck to dodge the flying ball.
meanings.sent2: Remember to duck if something comes flying towards you.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken refuse to play hide-and-seek with the duck? It was tired of ducking all the time!
meanings.sent4: She had to duck under the tree branches to pass through.
meanings.sent5: The ninja had to duck swiftly to avoid the enemy's attack.

meanings.sent1: The duck ducked under the surface of the pond.
meanings.sent2: I watched the duck duck under the water effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: Why did the duck challenge the fish to a diving contest? It wanted to show off its ducking skills!
meanings.sent4: She ducked under the wave just in time.
meanings.sent5: The swimmer had to duck under the floating log in the river.

meanings.definition: A quick lowering of the head or body.
meanings.sent1: With a quick duck, he avoided the branch.
meanings.sent2: Her duck saved her from hitting the door frame.
meanings.sent3: Why did the duck wear a helmet? To protect its head during all the quick ducks!
meanings.sent4: The sudden duck surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The duck of the child made the teacher smile.
